results.title: Connemara and its ponies
results.brief_description: A visual essay on Connemara, situated on the west coast of Eire, in spring and autumn. Includes scenes of the wildlife, the ponies, and the life of the people on the farms.

results.title: Congo: the way ahead
results.creator_credit: Frank Jacoby, Robert Morgan, George Movshon and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: Through the eyes of a 15-year-old Congo schoolboy, reveals the current (1963) situation in the Congo. The tragic circumstances which since 1960 have led to a decline in the standards of living of millions of people - the story of the patient painstaking efforts of the Congo people to build a modern and flourishing state are vividly portrayed, and the UN efforts to help.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Jacoby, Robert Morgan, George Movshon and United Nations. Office of Public Information

results.title: Confrontation: a nurse and an addict
results.creator_credit: Peter Schnitzler and Extension Media Center, University of California
results.brief_description: Poses questions regarding the professionals’ approach toward drug users. Demonstrates the conflict that arises between a white middle class nurse and a drug addict from a ghetto in hospital on a methadone program.

results.title: Conformity and independence (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Stanley Milgram, Harry From and Calvin Communications
results.brief_description: The topic of conformity is at the heart of any course in social psychology, and any treatment of the topic must rely heavily on the classic materials of Sherif, Asch and to a lesser extent Milgram, Kelman, Crutchfield, Moscovici, etc. The phenomena of conformity are relevant to the students’ own experience. Demonstrates laboratory work while maximising student involvement.

results.title: Conflict
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
Descriptions and illustrations of the four classes of motivational conflict (after Dollard and Millar) are shown, demonstrating the basic research on animals and then generalising this into an understanding of human behaviour. Laboratory animals (rats, in this case) in a typical T-maze experiment point out the principles used in analysing and interpreting the behaviour of high school and university students.

results.title: The Confident learner: self-esteem in children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Thomas W. Gregroy and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how the teacher can create conditions whereby a child can learn to build a self image of competence, a willingness to take risks, an ability to deal with mistakes, and self motivation.
